alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 28 at 5:53AM AKDT until August 28 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley and Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west. This includes the cities of Ambler, Shungnak, Kobuk, Wiseman, Coldfoot, Iniakuk Lake, Allakaket, Hughes, Bettles. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rain may result in flooding of smaller rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. At this time, flooding of the mainstem of the Koyukuk, Noatak and Kobuk Rivers is not expected, but those rivers will see sharp rises this week. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 2 and 3 inches of rain has fallen over the past several days over the Upper Noatak Valley, the Kobuk Valley, and the Koyukuk Valley and Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west. Many streams in the Koyukuk Basin from the Dalton Highway West, and in the Kobuk and Upper Noatak valleys are near bankfull now and some could be flooding. Small rivers will likely rise today and could flood low lying area today and Tue. At this time the mainstem of the Kobuk, Noatak and Koyukuk Rivers are not expect to flood but they will have sharp rises this week. Widespread heavy rain late this week could bring another risk of flooding late this week. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
